thread.title: James Brown's drummer Clyde Stubblefield dies at 73 | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: James Brown's drummer Clyde Stubblefield dies at 73 | Daily Mail Online

author: Associated Press
title: James Brown's drummer Clyde Stubblefield dies at 73 | Daily Mail Online
text: show ad James Brown's 'Funky Drummer' Clyde Stubblefield, who created famous drum break that was sampled on over 1,000 songs, dies at 73 Clyde Stubblefield, a drummer for James Brown who created one of the most widely sampled drum breaks ever, died Saturday. He was 73 Stubblefield died of kidney failure at a Madison, Wisconsin, hospital around noon, his wife Jody Hannon said He performed on several of Brown's classics in the 1960s and early 70s But he was best known for a short solo on Brown's 1970 single, Funky Drummer Rolling Stone magazine said it was sampled on over 1,000 songs and served as the backbeat for countless hip-hop tracks Published: 00:38 GMT, 19 February 2017 | Updated: 02:22 GMT, 19 February 2017 8 shares
